title: Quick Doenjang Stew
ingredients: - 5 cups Mushroom Stock, homemade or store-bought
- ¼ cup doenjang or miso (white, red, whatever you’ve got)
- 1 pound firm tofu, drained and cut into 1-inch cubes
- ½ pound trimmed green and/or yellow summer squash, cut into 1-inch cubes
- 1 small russet potato, peeled, quartered, and sliced ¼ inch thick (1 cup)
- ¼ cup finely chopped ginger (a fat 4-inch knob)
directions: 1. In a small mixing bowl, combine 2 tablespoons of the mushroom stock with the doenjang and stir until smooth.
2. To a medium pot, add the remaining stock along with the tofu, squash, potato, onion, ginger, chilies, and gochugaru.
3. Stir in the doenjang mixture and bring to a boil over high heat.
4. Reduce the heat to a gentle simmer and cook until the vegetables are soft, about 10 minutes.
5. Season with salt to taste and serve hot.
